entries: You can attempt to wrest a weapon from your opponent. In place of one attack, you can spend one Instinct to make a melee attack roll, which sets the DC for your opponent's Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check. If they fail, they let go of one item or object they are holding, which falls into their current space if applicable.

optionalfeature.name: Alpha Strike
entries: Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} when you roll initiative, you can replace the result of your {@dice d20} roll with a 20.
When you do this, the first attack roll you make is also replaced with a 20.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of all Horizons
entries: When you cause a Beast or Monstrosity that is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} to take damage, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it becomes {@condition Frightened|XPHB} of you and will attempt to flee the encounter by the fastest available means. A creature can be forced to make this save only once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Land, Sea and Sky
entries: You are adept at travelling the regions that most humanoids rarely do. When you travel through forests, plains, or regions with little solid ground such as the sky or large bodies of water, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, and you can forage for food anywhere.
Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks made to control vehicle such as boats or airships.

optionalfeature.name: Exploit Opening
entries: When you would get a trophy from a creature, you can forgo that opportunity to instead create one of the following weaknesses to take your target down:

items: One of the creature's resistances or immunities is removed until the start of your next turn.
The creature becomes {@variantrule vulnerability|XPHB|vulnerable} to your next attack.
The creature becomes {@condition Dazed|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you add your Hunter's Die to all saving throws that you make.

optionalfeature.name: Thrill of the Hunt
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to one roll of your Hunter's Die if you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} and have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Point|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of Fables
entries: You are trained to fight all manner of creatures, from the fantastical to the real. When you roll initiative, you can make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) ability check to determine one of the Traits or Legendary Actions of a creature you can see, with a DC equal to 10 plus the creature's CR (maximum 30). You can add your Hunter's Die to this roll.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Myths
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks in environments that are home to Legendary creatures - such as volcanoes, the deepest caves, barren wastes or vast swamps. In such locations, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any conditions, and while tracking other creatures you can learn their number and when they last passed through the area.
Furthermore, you have advantage on any saving throws made against environmental hazards such as heat or cold.

optionalfeature.name: Previvify
entries: You can use an {@action Action|XPHB} on your turn to revive a friendly creature within your reach who is at zero hit points. They regain hit points equal to twice your Hunter level and gain the benefits of your {@subclassFeature Rally|Hunter|Starlight|Fable|Starlight|7|Starlight} and {@subclassFeature Commander|Hunter|Starlight|Fable|Starlight|3|Starlight} features (movement only). Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again until you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: You guide your allies to success through your knowledge of these legendary creatures. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, when your Quarry succeeds a saving throw against one of your allies' effects, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause it to take damage equal to four rolls of your Hunter's Die.

optionalfeature.name: Slayer of Legends
entries: When a Legendary creature is your Quarry, your Hunter's Die becomes {@dice 2d6} instead of {@dice 1d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Conduit
entries: You may add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage you deal with any cantrip that deals fire, cold, thunder, lightning, or acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Intuition
entries: You learn the {@spell Guidance|XPHB} cantrip. It has a duration of ten minutes when you cast it.

optionalfeature.name: Moon's Spirit
entries: You do not need to sleep and cannot be forced to by any means. You can gain a long rest by doing 8 hours of light activity instead of sleeping.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Warrior
entries: You learn the {@spell Shillelagh} cantrip, and when you cast it it lasts for ten minutes and can be applied to any weapon with which you are proficient.

optionalfeature.name: Roots of the Tree
entries: You may a add bonus equal to your proficiency bonus to saving throws made to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Understanding
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} and at will and without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Darkseer
entries: You gain darkvision out to 120 feet, or increase your existing darkvision by 120 feet. Your darkvision makes darkness appear as bright light to you, instead of dim.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Arcana
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good}, and {@spell Detect Poison and Disease} once per long rest each, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Lightfeet
entries: You learn the {@spell Longstrider|XPHB} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Jungle's Bounty
entries: You can cast the {@spell Goodberry|XPHB} spell once per long rest. When you cast the spell in this way, you create an additional number of berries equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} and {@skill Medicine} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Far Sight
entries: As part of an hour-long ritual, you look into the future, sensing a power you might require. You may ask a question about an event to occur within the next 7 days, and the DM may suggest a spell or type of spell that would prove beneficial. You can then swap one spell that you know for another on the Shaman spell list. You may do this only once each {@dice 2d4} days.
{@note The spell you can learn follows normal rules. For example, a 6th level Shaman could learn a 3rd level spell or lower, even if they had 4th level spell slots.}

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Manipulation
entries: You can change the damage type of a spell you cast to the damage type of your Elemental Affinity.

optionalfeature.name: Home at Sea
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a swimming speed, this increases it by 10 feet instead.
You also learn the {@spell Water Breathing|XPHB} spell, which doesn't count against your known Shaman spells.

optionalfeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: You gain a climbing speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a climbing speed, it increases to that amount
You learn the {@spell Spider Climbing} spell and cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Heart
entries: You learn the {@spell Summon Fey|TCE} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Gifts of the Elders
entries: You learn the {@spell Borrowed Knowledge|SCC} and {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB} spells.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Thorns
entries: Upon taking damage from a creature you can see, or one that is within 5 feet of you, you can spend a reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 11th level.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Elemental Superiority
entries: When you deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity, you ignore resistance to damage of that type.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Teachings
entries: You learn the {@spell Polymorph} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aversion
entries: You learn the {@spell Elemental Bane|XGE} spell. Once per long rest, when you cast this spell, you can forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on it by reducing its duration to the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Keeper of the Grove
entries: Once per short rest, you can attempt to allow nature to siphon a creature's magic for a turn.
The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@dice 3d12} radiant damage and becomes {@condition silenced|Starlight} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Small Friends
entries: You learn the {@spell Insect Plague|XPHB} spell. You can communicate with insects freely.

optionalfeature.name: Nature Companion
entries: You can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell once per long rest without expending material components. Your familiar takes the form of a {@creature Sapling Treant|Starlight} or a {@creature Raven|MM}.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Walker
entries: You learn the {@spell Transport Via Plants|XPHB} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Roots
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast the Grasping vine spell. When you do so, you can either cast the spell as a bonus action, or forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Command of Air
entries: You can cast the {@spell Fly|XPHB} spell at will.

optionalfeature.name: Earthly Intuition
entries: You gain Tremorsense to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Will
entries: If you cast a spell and miss all of its attack roll(s), or all targets pass their saving throws to resist its effect, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action instead of an action. You may do this once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Searing Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Searing Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which causes creatures to {@condition burning|Starlight|burn} on entering the area, or take {@damage 1d4} fire damage if they are already burning.

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Flames
entries: The size of your spells that deal fire damage, if they specify an area, increase by 5 feet when you cast them (for example, {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} increases from a 15-foot cone to a 20-foot cone). If a spell specifies multiple dimensions, such as {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB}, you choose one to increase.

optionalfeature.name: Compound Burns
entries: Your {@b Growing Heat} feature improves. A creature now takes additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus any time they take fire damage, instead of only when you deal it. The effect's duration is still only increased by you.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Glacial Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which, to creatures you choose, makes the area surrounding it difficult terrain and prevents regaining of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Block
entries: On the turn that you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage to one or more creatures, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus times the number of creatures you deal cold damage to with that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Absolute Zero
entries: Your {@b Biting Cold} feature is enhanced. The penalty now applies to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that the target makes. It also imposes disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Voltaic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Voltaic Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which prevents creatures of your choice within its area from taking reactions.

optionalfeature.name: Spasming Shocks
entries: Once per round, if you deal lightning damage to a creature by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can cause it to be {@condition staggered|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Aftershock
entries: Your {@b Arc Lightning} feature improves. It can now affect up to four targets, and the range limitation of 15 feet is between targets affected by this feature, not the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Booming Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which creates a shockwave that pushes creatures of your choosing away from the totem.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Thunderclap
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature with a spell of at least 3rd level, it must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Reverberating Thunder
entries: Your {@b Thundercrack} feature improves. You are able to push creatures of any size, and the distance increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Caustic Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which reduces the AC of creatures of your choice in its area by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Erosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Shaman spell save DC or become {@condition sundered|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.
If the spell already requires a saving throw, this effect takes place if that saving throw is failed, instead of requiring the additional Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Acid
entries: Your {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature improves. A creature suffering from the effect is {@condition Hampered|Starlight} and deals {@damage 1d4} less damage with weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Resilience
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Unwavering Spirit|Shaman|Starlight|Mountains|Starlight|1|Starlight|unwavering spirit}, you can grant a creature resistance to the triggering damage alongside your normal reduction. This lasts until the start of their next turn.
You can do this once, and must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Mountains
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: High-pressure Jet
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Ebb and Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|1|Starlight|Ebb and Flow water jet}, also pushes creatures back 5 feet when you hit them with it. At level 14, this increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Affinity Jet
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Ebb and Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|1|Starlight|Ebb and Flow water jet}, you can choose to make its damage match your elemental affinity instead of bludgeoning.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Waters
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you regain 15 hit points at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Mirage
entries: When using your {@subclassFeature Mirage|Shaman|Starlight|Dunes|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity equal to your proficiency bonus to all other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the space you left.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Dunes
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you gain an additional reaction each round.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Forests
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you are naturally camouflaged. When taking damage, you can use a reaction to become {@condition Invisible} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Totem Summoning
entries: You gain the ability to conjure a Nature Spirit Totem. This tiny elemental creature applies an effect to an area within 15 feet of itself. If a totem deals damage, you are considered to have done that damage.

Summoning a totem requires an action, and the totem appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you, and lasts for one minute. Once summoned, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest or unless you expend a spell slot of first level or higher.

The totem requires your {@status concentration} (as if you were concentrating on a spell), however, you can summon additional totems using the same concentration. Whenever you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration, you choose one totem to disappear. If you use another effect which requires concentration such as a spell, they all disappear.
You know how to summon two totems from the list below. You can change your selection whenever you gain a level in this class.

items: {@creature Taunting Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Warding Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Warning Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Lifting Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Blessing Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}

optionalfeature.name: Totemkeeper
entries: When expending a spell slot to summon a totem, you may summon two at once if the spell slot expended is of third level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Blast
entries: Your totems gain the ability to launch a blast of elemental magic. The blast uses your spell attack modifier, is fired from an active totem using your bonus action, and deals {@damage 1d8+PB} damage of a type matching your elemental affinity.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Might
entries: When you summon a totem, it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Commander
entries: You have greater control over where your totems are summoned. You can summon them in the air, or attached to you or a willing creature.

A totem attached to a creature moves with it, but can still be targeted individually. If attached to a creature, you can expend a reaction to force the totem to be the new target of an attack that would otherwise hit the creature it is attached to.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Specialist
entries: You learn how to summon two more totems from the list in the {@optfeature Rune of Totem Summoning|Starlight}.
Furthermore, your totems become proficient in all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Enforcement Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Enforcement Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which grants creatures of your choice temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns and prevents them from being moved against their will.

optionalfeature.name: Manarage Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Manarage Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}. You can summon it once per short rest and it provides the following benefits:

Creatures within the area may cast one first-level spell without expending a spell slot, or use any feature which can be used more than once per short rest, without expending a use of that feature, but no more than once per turn.

spell.name: Earth Shock
entries: You channel the earth's might to suppress another creature. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition Silenced|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Frost Shock

components.m: An drop of water or an ice cube

entries: You conjure a mote of pure cold and launch it at your target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it is {@condition Slowed|Starlight} instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vitality Hex

components.m: A used match, torch, or lantern

entries: You weave a cloak of shadow over a target's lifeforce. The target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage becomes hexed for the duration of the spell. While hexed, once on each turn when the target takes damage (including from the casting of this spell), you regain {@damage 1d6} hit points. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing gained increases to {@damage 2d6} and any damage the target takes is increased by {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Divine Shield
entries: You bestow a divine boon on a creature, protecting it from harm.

The first time a creature would take damage while under the effects of this spell, they instead take none. If an effect deals multiple damage types simultaneously, the creature is protected from all of them.
The spell ends after protecting a creature once, or if the target completes a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Holy Nova
entries: Divine light surges forth from you. You may choose any 6 creatures within a 30-foot radius, centered on you.

Creatures you choose gain a Divine Shield, as with the {@spell Divine Shield|S:Spells} spell. Any remaining creatures must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save. The divine light harmlessly washes over every other creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d6|4-9|1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Consecrate

components.m: a weapon or staff worth at least 1sp

entries: You strike, or plant your weapon into, the ground, sending ripples of force through it. Any creature touching the same surface within a 50-foot cone (the spell covers up to 10 feet of elevation changes (such as a small wall or hole), but is blocked by a break in the surface) must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 10d4} radiant damage and fall {@condition prone|phb}. On a successful save, they take half damage and do not fall {@condition prone|phb}.

Celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead have disadvantage on the saving throw. Furthermore, the ground within the spell's area is considered difficult terrain for those creature types for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot above 4th level, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d4|4-9|1d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Arcane Butterflies
entries: A 20 foot cube within range is briefly filled with a burst of glowing spectral butterflies. Creatures within the area must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and must use all of their movement in a random direction on their turn. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and do not have to use their movement randomly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot above 2nd level, the spell increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Raelynn's Purification Aura
entries: A 30-foot radius area around you is filled with purifying energy pulled from the warmth of the stars. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) can't become diseased and has resistance to poison damage.

Furthermore, those creatures have advantage on saving throws against effects that cause any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition dazed|S: Conditions}, {@condition disoriented|S: Conditions}, {@condition shocked|S: Conditions}, {@condition bleeding|S: Conditions} and {@condition weakened|S: Conditions}.

spell.name: Raelynn's Lesser Restoration
entries: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition dazed|S: Conditions}, {@condition disoriented|S: Conditions}, {@condition silenced|S: Conditions}, or {@condition weakened|S: Conditions}.

spell.name: Pixie Sparks
entries: You conjure a volley of disorienting Feywild sparks to assail your target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and the next attack made against it before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the treant is animate.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.
